sen.j: 小瀬鵜飼（おぜうかい）とは、岐阜県関市小瀬の長良川で毎年5月11日から10月15日まで行われる鵜飼いである。
sen.e: Oze ukai is ukai (cormorant fishing) that is conducted in Nagara-gawa river at Oze, Seki City, Gifu Prefecture during the period from May 11 to October 15 every year.
Oze ukai is ukai (cormorant fishing) that is conducted in Nagara-gawa river at Oze, Seki City, Gifu Prefecture during the period from May 11 to October 15 every year.
Oze ukai is ukai (cormorant fishing) that is conducted in Nagara-gawa river at Oze, Seki City, Gifu Prefecture during the period from May 11 to October 15 every year.

sen.j: 中秋の名月と増水時を除く毎夜行われる。
sen.e: It is conducted every night except for the day of harvest moon and when the river rises.
It is conducted every night except for the day of harvest moon and when the river rises.
It is conducted every night except for the day of harvest moon and when the river rises.

sen.j: 中秋の名月に行われないのは、満月の月明かりにより篝火に鮎が集まりにくいためである。
sen.e: The reason why it is not conducted on the day of harvest moon is that sweetfishes are not lured by kagaribi (fishing fire) due to the light of full moon.
The reason why it is not conducted on the day of harvest moon is that ayu (sweetfish, Plecoglossus altivelis altivelis) are not lured by kagaribi (fishing fire) due to the light of full moon.
sen.cmt: 鮎は用語集の登録語句にあわせて変更しました。篝火は登録がありましたが、魚をおびき寄せる火という意味を考慮し、そのままにしてあります。
sen.e: The reason why it is not conducted on the day of harvest moon is that ayu (sweetfish, Plecoglossus altivelis altivelis) are not lured by kagaribi (fishing fire) due to the light of full moon.

sen.j: 関市の鮎ノ瀬橋上流付近で行なわれる。
sen.e: It is conducted in the upper course of Ayunose bridge in Seki City.
It is conducted in the upper course of Ayunose bridge in Seki City.
It is conducted in the upper course of Ayunose bridge in Seki City.

sen.j: 長良川の鵜飼いとしては、岐阜市の長良川鵜飼が有名であるが、小瀬鵜飼も長良川鵜飼と同じ皇室御用の鵜飼であり、鵜匠は職名を宮内庁式部職鵜匠という。
sen.e: Although Nagaragawa ukai that is conducted in Gifu City is famous, Oze ukai is also patronized by the Imperial Court as with Nagaragawa ukai and the official job title of ujo (a fisherman of cormorant fishing) is Kunaicho (Imperial Household Agency) shikibushoku ujo.

Although Nagaragawa ukai that is conducted in Gifu City is famous, Oze ukai is also patronized by the Imperial Court as with Nagaragawa ukai and the official job title of ujo (a fisherman of cormorant fishing) is Kunaicho (Imperial Household Agency) shikibushoku ujo.

Although Nagaragawa ukai that is conducted in Gifu City is famous, Oze ukai is also patronized by the Imperial Court as with Nagaragawa ukai and the official job title of ujo (a fisherman of cormorant fishing) is Kunaicho (Imperial Household Agency) shikibushoku ujo.

sen.j: 長良川の鵜飼用具一式122点は国の重要有形民俗文化財、小瀬鵜飼技法は関市指定無形民俗文化財である。
sen.e: A set of tools for ukai in Nagara-gawa river, a total of 122 pieces, are designated as national important tangible assets of folk culture, and the fishing method of Oze ukai is designated as intangible folk cultural asset by Seki City.

A set of tools for ukai in Nagara-gawa river, a total of 122 pieces, are designated as national important tangible assets of folk culture, and the fishing method of Oze ukai is designated as intangible folk cultural asset by Seki City.

A set of tools for ukai in Nagara-gawa river, a total of 122 pieces, are designated as national important tangible assets of folk culture, and the fishing method of Oze ukai is designated as intangible folk cultural asset by Seki City.

sen.j: 同じ長良川で行なわれる長良川鵜飼と比べて小規模であることは否めないが、観光化が著しい長良川鵜飼と比べて昔からの漁法としての鵜飼いが色濃く残っており、人気があるという。
sen.e: Its scale is no doubt smaller than that of Nagara-gawa ukai, but it is still popular since it has a trace of traditional fishing method of ukai compared with Nagara-gawa ukai that has become the event of tourist attraction.

Its scale is no doubt smaller than that of Nagara-gawa ukai, but it is still popular since it has a trace of traditional fishing method of ukai compared with Nagara-gawa ukai that has become the event of tourist attraction.

Its scale is no doubt smaller than that of Nagara-gawa ukai, but it is still popular since it has a trace of traditional fishing method of ukai compared with Nagara-gawa ukai that has become the event of tourist attraction.

sen.j: 鵜飼に使用する鵜はウミウを使っている。
sen.e: Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai.
Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai.
Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai.

sen.j: これはカワウに比べ海鵜の方が体が大きく丈夫なためである。
sen.e: This is because temminck's cormorants are bigger and stronger than common cormorants.
This is because temminck's cormorants are bigger and stronger than common cormorants.
This is because temminck's cormorants are bigger and stronger than common cormorants.

sen.j: 野生の海鵜を捕獲してきて3年訓練した後、鵜飼で使用される。
sen.e: Temminck's cormorants are used for ukai after having been trained for two to three years.
Captured wild temminck's cormorants are used for ukai after having been trained for three years.
sen.cmt: 「野生の海鵜を捕獲してきて」の部分を表現するため、文頭にCaptured wildをつけました。「3年訓練した後」が 2 to 3 yearsとなっており、原文をWebで確認しましたが、3年となっていました。for three years に変更しましたが、2～3年と厳密に3年と言い切ることを避けているとも思われます。
sen.e: Captured wild temminck's cormorants are used for ukai after having been trained for three years.

sen.j: 鵜匠の装束は、風折烏帽子、漁服、胸あて、腰蓑という古式ゆかしいものである
sen.e: Ujo weras traditional shozoku (formal clothes) including kazaorieboshi, ryofuku (clothes for fishing), muneate (bib) and koshimino (grass skirt).
Ujo wears traditional shozoku (formal clothes) including kazaori eboshi (a traditional black fold-back cap), ryofuku (clothes for fishing), muneate (bib) and koshimino (grass skirt).
sen.cmt: ①「風折烏帽子」を用語集の登録語句にあわせて変更しました。②weras→wearsに修正しました。
sen.e: Ujo wears traditional shozoku (formal clothes) including kazaori eboshi (a traditional black fold-back cap), ryofuku (clothes for fishing), muneate (bib) and koshimino (grass skirt).

sen.j: 舟首に篝火を付けた鵜舟に鵜匠が乗り10羽前後の鵜を手縄をさばき、操り、篝火に集まってきた鮎を鵜が次々に捕る。
sen.e: Ujo gets on ubune (a boat used for ukai) with kagaribi at its bow and controls around 10 cormorants by handling tenawa (a hand rope), and cormorants catch sweetfishes that gather under kagaribi.
Ujo gets on ubune (a boat used for ukai) with kagaribi at its bow and controls around 10 cormorants by handling tenawa (a hand rope), and cormorants catch ayu that gather under kagaribi.
Ujo gets on ubune (a boat used for ukai) with kagaribi at its bow and controls around 10 cormorants by handling tenawa (a hand rope), and cormorants catch ayu that gather under kagaribi.

sen.j: 鵜匠は常日頃から鵜と一緒に生活しているため、鵜匠と鵜は呼吸の合った動きを見せ、見事に鮎を捕らえてくる。
sen.e: As ujo always lives together with cormorants, ujo and cormorants get along perfectly and cormorants catch sweetfishes neatly.
As ujo always lives together with cormorants, ujo and cormorants get along perfectly and cormorants catch ayu neatly.
As ujo always lives together with cormorants, ujo and cormorants get along perfectly and cormorants catch ayu neatly.

sen.j: 鵜の捕った鮎は鵜匠のより吐き篭に吐かせられる。
sen.e: Ujo gets cormorants to spit out a sweetfish into a basket.
Ujo gets cormorants to let them spit out ayu into a basket.
sen.cmt: ①sweetfishes→ayuに変更しました。②ｔo spit out→to let them spit outに変更しました。
sen.e: Ujo gets cormorants to let them spit out ayu into a basket.

sen.j: 鵜の喉の紐は調節可能であり、一定の大きさ以下の鮎は鵜の胃袋に入る。
sen.e: As a string tied around the throat of cormorant is adjustable, a sweetfish smaller than a certain size is swallowed into a cormorant's stomach.
As a string tied around the throat of cormorant is adjustable, an ayu smaller than a certain size is swallowed into a cormorant's stomach.
As a string tied around the throat of cormorant is adjustable, an ayu smaller than a certain size is swallowed into a cormorant's stomach.

sen.j: 皇室御用の鵜飼。
sen.e: Goryo ukai means ukai that is patronized by the Imperial Court
Goryo ukai means ukai that is patronized by the Imperial Court
Goryo ukai means ukai that is patronized by the Imperial Court

sen.j: 小瀬鵜飼は、宮内庁式部職鵜匠によって行われている。
sen.e: Oze ukai is conducted by Kunaicho shikibushoku ujo.
Oze ukai is conducted by Kunaicho shikibushoku ujo.
Oze ukai is conducted by Kunaicho shikibushoku ujo.

sen.j: 2007年現在の小瀬の鵜匠は3人おり、これらは全て代々世襲制である。
sen.e: There are three ujo at Oze as of 2007, and all of them have inherited the job based on the hereditary system.
There are three ujo at Oze as of 2007, and all of them have inherited the job based on the hereditary system.
There are three ujo at Oze as of 2007, and all of them have inherited the job based on the hereditary system.

sen.j: この鵜匠たちにより期間中に宮内庁の御料場で行われる8回の鵜飼を「御料鵜飼」という。
sen.e: Ukai that is conducted by these ujo eight times during the season at Kunaicho's goryoba ((fishing ground for the Imperial Court) is called "goryo ukai".
Ukai that is conducted by these ujo eight times during the season at Kunaicho's goryoba (fishing ground for the Imperial Court) is called "goryo ukai".
sen.cmt: 「((fishing」括弧が2重になっていたため、1つ削除しました。
sen.e: Ukai that is conducted by these ujo eight times during the season at Kunaicho's goryoba (fishing ground for the Imperial Court) is called "goryo ukai."
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を調整

sen.j: 御料鵜飼で獲れた鮎は皇居へ献上されるのみならず、明治神宮や伊勢神宮へも奉納される。
sen.e: Sweetfishes that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.
Ayu that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.
Ayu that are caught in goryo ukai are offered not only to the Imperial Palace but also to Meiji-jingu Shrine and Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 岩佐昌秋
sen.e: Masaaki IWASA
Masaaki IWASA
Masaaki IWASA

sen.j: 足立太一
sen.e: Taichi ADACHI
Taichi ADACHI
Taichi ADACHI

sen.j: 足立陽一郎
sen.e: Yoichiro ADACHI
Yoichiro ADACHI
Yoichiro ADACHI

sen.j: 見所なのは「狩り下り」といい、鵜匠が乗る鵜船と観光客が乗る屋形船が一緒になって下る。
sen.e: The highlight is called "karikudari", which means the time when ubune carrying ujo and yakata-bune (roofed pleasure boat) carrying tourist go down the river side by side,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: The highlight is called "karikudari", which means the time when ubune carrying ujo and yakata-bune (roofed pleasure boat) carrying tourist go down the river side by side,
The highlight is called "karikudari", which means the time when ubune carrying ujo and yakata-bune (roofed pleasure boat) carrying tourist go down the river side by side,

sen.j: このため、間近で鵜匠の鵜を操る手縄さばきや鵜が鮎を捕る姿が見られる。
sen.e: Therefore, tourists can get a close look at the scene where ujo is handling tenawa and cormorants are catching sweetfishes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Therefore, tourists can get a close look at the scene where ujo is handling tenawa and cormorants are catching ayu.
Therefore, tourists can get a close look at the scene where ujo is handling tenawa and cormorants are catching ayu.

sen.j: 尚、長良川鵜飼や木曽川うかいと異なり、屋形船での食事は無い（漁場へ向かう途中の船内で弁当はある）。
sen.e: Unlike Nagaragawa ukai and Kisogawa ukai, food is not served on yakata-bune (box lunches are availabe on a ship transporting tourists to fishing ground).
Unlike Nagaragawa ukai and Kisogawa ukai, food is not served on yakata-bune (box lunches are available on a ship transporting tourists to fishing ground).
Unlike Nagaragawa ukai and Kisogawa ukai, food is not served on yakata-bune (box lunches are available on a ship transporting tourists to fishing ground).

sen.j: 鵜飼自体を楽しむものである。
sen.e: Enjoying ukai itself is the purpose.
Enjoying ukai itself is the purpose.
Enjoying ukai itself is the purpose.

sen.j: 小瀬鵜飼の特徴としては、以下の点がある。
sen.e: The followings are the characteristics of Oze ukai.
The followings are the characteristics of Oze ukai.
The followings are the characteristics of Oze ukai.

sen.j: 回りは一面山で道路や照明が無く、明かりは篝火、ろうそくのみの漆黒の舞台で行われる。
sen.e: As the river is surrounded by mountains and there are no roads or lightings, ukai is conducted in the dark using only the light of kagaribi and candles.
As the river is surrounded by mountains and there are no roads or lightings, ukai is conducted in the dark using only the light of kagaribi and candles.
As the river is surrounded by mountains and there are no roads or lightings, ukai is conducted in the dark using only the light of kagaribi and candles.

sen.j: 鵜飼開始前の鵜匠の準備風景や、廻し場という鵜匠の打ち合わせ場所、終了後の片付け風景を見学が可能である。
sen.e: It is possible to see the scene of ujo's preparation, the place called "mawashiba" where ujo has a meeting and the scene of cleanup after ukai ended.
It is possible to see the scene of ujo's preparation, the place called "mawashiba" where ujo has a meeting and the scene of cleanup after ukai ended.
It is possible to see the scene of ujo's preparation, the place called "mawashiba" where ujo has a meeting and the scene of cleanup after ukai ended.

sen.j: 狩り下りでは、鵜飼船と屋形船が一緒になって下るので間近で様子が見える。
sen.e: During karikudari, it is possible to get a close look since ubune and yakata-bune go down the river side by side.
During karikudari, it is possible to get a close look since ubune and yakata-bune go down the river side by side.
During karikudari, it is possible to get a close look since ubune and yakata-bune go down the river side by side.

sen.j: 静水ではなく、鮎漁本来の姿、瀬を下りながら漁を行う。
sen.e: Fishing is done while descending the rapids, not on still water, according to the original way of sweetfish fishing.
Fishing is done while descending the rapids, not on still water, according to the original way of ayu fishing.
Fishing is done while descending the rapids, not on still water, according to the original way of ayu fishing.

sen.j: 鵜飼船、観覧用屋形船ともに動力を持たない手漕ぎ船である。
sen.e: Neither ubune nor yakata-bune for tourists has engines and they are rowed.
Neither ubune nor yakata-bune for tourists has engines and they are rowed.
Neither ubune nor yakata-bune for tourists has engines and they are rowed.

sen.j: 長良川鵜飼は1300年ほど前から行われていたという。
sen.e: It is said that Nagaragawa ukai has been conducted for around 1,300 years.
It is said that Nagaragawa ukai has been conducted for around 1,300 years.
It is said that Nagaragawa ukai has been conducted for around 1,300 years.

sen.j: 平安時代、美濃国方県郡七郷の鵜飼について記述がある。
sen.e: A record is existent that ukai was conducted in Shichigo, Katagata County, Mino Province in the Heian period.
A record is existent that ukai was conducted in Shichigo, Katagata County, Mino Province in the Heian period.
A record is existent that ukai was conducted in Shichigo, Katagata County, Mino Province in the Heian period.

sen.j: 方県郡七郷は、後の本巣郡七郷村、黒野村（現岐阜市）付近といわれている。
sen.e: It is said that Shichigo, Katagata County concides to the place called Shichigo Village and Kurono Village of Motosu County in later times (current Gifu City).
It is said that Shichigo, Katagata County coincides with the place called Shichigo Village and Kurono Village of Motosu County in later times (current Gifu City).
sen.cmt: concides to→coincides withに修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that Shichigo, Katagata County coincides with the place called Shichigo Village and Kurono Village of Motosu County in later times (current Gifu City).

sen.j: 室町時代の頃、方県郡七郷の鵜飼漁を行なっていた者が、方県郡長良（後の稲葉郡長良村、現岐阜市）と各務郡岩田（後の稲葉郡岩田村、現岐阜市）に移住する。
sen.e: During the Muromachi period, people who were engaged in ukai fishing at Shichigo, Katagata County moved to Nagara, Katagata County (Nagara Village of Inaba County, current Gifu City) and Iwata, Kagami County (Iwata Village of Inaba County, current Gifu City).

During the Muromachi period, people who were engaged in ukai fishing at Shichigo, Katagata County moved to Nagara, Katagata County (Nagara Village of Inaba County, current Gifu City) and Iwata, Kagami County (Iwata Village of Inaba County, current Gifu City).

During the Muromachi period, people who were engaged in ukai fishing at Shichigo, Katagata County moved to Nagara, Katagata County (Nagara Village of Inaba County, current Gifu City) and Iwata, Kagami County (Iwata Village of Inaba County, current Gifu City).

sen.j: 1504年（永正元年）、各務郡岩田の鵜飼漁を行なっていた者が、武儀郡小瀬（現関市）に移住し、小瀬鵜飼が始まる（1534年の説もある）。
sen.e: Oze ukai began in 1504 when people who had been engaged in ukai fishing at Iwata, Kagami County moved to Oze, Mugi County (current Seki City) (another theory is 1534).
Oze ukai began in 1504 when people who had been engaged in ukai fishing at Iwata, Kagami County moved to Oze, Mugi County (current Seki City) (another theory is 1534).
Oze ukai began in 1504 when people who had been engaged in ukai fishing at Iwata, Kagami County moved to Oze, Mugi County (current Seki City) (another theory is 1534).

sen.j: 別の説では、1500年頃、小瀬付近の鮎漁権を握っていた足立新兵衛が始めたともいう。
sen.e: Some people assert that Oze ukai was inaugurated around in 1500 by Shinbei ADACHI, a person who held the right of sweetfish fishing at Oze.
Some people assert that Oze ukai was inaugurated around in 1500 by Shinbei ADACHI, a person who held the right of ayu fishing at Oze.
Some people assert that Oze ukai was inaugurated around in 1500 by Shinbei ADACHI, a person who held the right of ayu fishing at Oze.

sen.j: 1564年（永禄7年）、織田信長が長良川の鵜飼を見物し、鵜飼漁を行なう者に「鵜匠」の名称をあたえたという。
sen.e: In 1564, Nobunaga ODA saw the ukai conducted in Nagara-gawa river and gave a title of "ujo" to the persons engaged in ukai fishing.
In 1564, Nobunaga ODA saw the ukai conducted in Nagara-gawa river and gave a title of "ujo" to the persons engaged in ukai fishing.
In 1564, Nobunaga ODA saw the ukai conducted in Nagara-gawa river and gave a title of "ujo" to the persons engaged in ukai fishing.

sen.j: 江戸時代、徳川家康、江戸幕府、尾張藩などに保護される。
sen.e: Ukai was protected by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, Edo bakufu and Owari domain during the Edo period.
Ukai was protected by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, Edo bakufu and Owari domain during the Edo period.
Ukai was protected by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, Edo bakufu and Owari domain during the Edo period.

sen.j: 小瀬の鵜匠は、江戸中期に7人、幕末には5人いたという。
sen.e: At Oze, it is said, seven ujo existed in the middle of Edo period and five at the end of Edo period.
At Oze, it is said, seven ujo existed in the middle of Edo period and five at the end of Edo period.
At Oze, it is said, seven ujo existed in the middle of Edo period and five at the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 明治維新で衰退し、一時有栖川宮家御用となった。
sen.e: Oze ukai declined after the Meiji Restoration and was once patronized by the house of Imperial Prince Arisugawa.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Oze ukai declined after the Meiji Restoration and was once patronized by the house of Imperial Prince Arisugawa.
Oze ukai declined after the Meiji Restoration and was once patronized by the house of Imperial Prince Arisugawa.

sen.j: その後、1890年（明治23年）に宮内省主猟寮属となり、宮内省（現宮内庁）の直轄となる。
sen.e: Thereafter, it was affiliated to the Shuryoryo (division of hanting) of the Imperial Household Ministry (current Imperial Household Agency) in 1890.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Thereafter, it was affiliated to the Shuryoryo (division of hunting) of the Imperial Household Ministry (current Imperial Household Agency) in 1890.
Thereafter, it was affiliated to the Shuryoryo (division of hunting) of the Imperial Household Ministry (current Imperial Household Agency) in 1890.

sen.j: 鵜飼観賞と、食事や宿泊をしたい場合は、各鵜匠の家、旅館、ホテルなどに申し込み。
sen.e: Peole who need bed and board in addition to seeing ukai should contact with the house of ujo or hotels.
People who need bed and board in addition to seeing ukai should contact with the house of ujo or hotels.

sen.j: 国道418号「小瀬北」交差点より岐阜県道290号上野関線で鮎ノ瀬橋方面。
sen.e: From "Ozekita" intersection of National Highway 418, drive on the Gifu Prefectural Road 290 Ueno-Seki Route toward Ayunose bridge.

sen.j: 東海環状自動車道西関インターチェンジ（建設中）から約2km。
